tool.name: MDSimulator
tool.command:
#if $license_check ln -s '$struct_pdb' structure.pdb && ln -s '$struct_prmtop' structure.prmtop && mkdir -p build && cp structure.* build/ && python '$__tool_directory__/app.py' -inputdir build -constraints $run_type --use-gpu
#if $runtime -runtime $runtime #end if
#if $equiltime -equiltime $equiltime #end if
#if $ligresname -ligresname $ligresname #end if
#if $usegpu --use-gpu #end if #end if

param.name: run_type
param.label: Protocol type: protein or protein-ligand
param.option: Protein and ligand (please specify resname of the ligand below)

param.name: license_check
param.label: I accept the license conditions (https://software.acellera.com/news/license.pdf) and declare that I will not use this app for profit purposes.

validator.message: You must accept the conditions first.

param.name: ligresname
param.label: Resname of the ligand molecule, if present.

param.name: usegpu
param.label: Use GPU to speed up computation

tool.help:
Performs a simple MD simulation to a protein or protein-ligand system.
Check license conditions at: https://software.acellera.com/news/license.pdf
The .pdb file and the .prmtop file of the built system must be provided.
First, an equilibration step is run for the time specified.
Finally, a production run of the specified time follows.
This applications supports protein or protein-ligand systems.
In case a protein-ligand system is provided, the resname of the ligand has to be defined (usually MOL)
GPU can be used if available to speed up computations.
